tec.mongodb1: MongoDB is a distributed, scalable, and flexible document database.
tec.mongodb2: Fun Fact: The name 'MongoDB' comes from 'humongous', due to its ability to handle huge volumes of data.
tec.express1: Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework.
tec.express2: Fun Fact: Express is so minimal that many other popular frameworks like NestJS are built on top of it.
tec.android-studio1: The official IDE for Android development.
tec.android-studio2: Fun Fact: It is based on JetBrains' IntelliJ IDEA, known for being one of the smartest IDEs on the market.
tec.angular2: Fun Fact: Angular was completely rewritten from scratch in 2016 (Angular 2), breaking full compatibility with AngularJS.
tec.asp1: Microsoft technology for generating dynamic content.
tec.asp2: Fun Fact: ASP originally stood for 'Active Server Pages' and was Microsoft's first answer to PHP.
tec.aws-ec21: Resizable compute capacity in the cloud.
tec.aws-ec22: Fun Fact: EC2 was one of the first services launched by AWS in 2006, revolutionizing cloud computing.
tec.aws-lambda1: Run code without provisioning or managing servers.
tec.aws-lambda2: Fun Fact: Lambda popularized the 'Serverless' concept, allowing you to pay only for the milliseconds your code runs.
tec.aws-rds2: Fun Fact: RDS automates tedious tasks like backups and patching, which used to consume hours for administrators.
tec.aws-s31: Object storage built to retrieve any amount of data from anywhere.
tec.aws-s32: Fun Fact: S3 is rumored to store trillions of objects and is the backbone of much of the internet.
tec.bootstrap1: Most popular CSS framework for responsive mobile-first sites.
tec.bootstrap2: Fun Fact: It was originally called 'Twitter Blueprint' and was created by developers at Twitter.
tec.c-sharp1: Modern, object-oriented, and type-safe programming language.
tec.c-sharp2: Fun Fact: Its name C# is inspired by musical notation, where a '#' indicates a note one semitone higher than C.
tec.core1: .NET Core is a cross-platform, open-source framework.
tec.core2: Fun Fact: It was Microsoft's first giant step to bringing .NET to Linux and Mac natively.
tec.css1: Style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML.
tec.css2: Fun Fact: One of the initial proposals for CSS in 1994 included the ability for the user to control the style, not just the author.
tec.docker1: Platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers.
tec.docker2: Fun Fact: Docker popularized containers, but the underlying technology (cgroups) existed in Linux long before.
tec.figma2: Fun Fact: Figma was the first design tool built for the browser, enabling real-time collaboration.
tec.git1: Free and open source distributed version control system.
tec.git2: Fun Fact: Linus Torvalds created Git in just one weekend because he was frustrated with existing tools.
tec.html1: Standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
tec.html2: Fun Fact: The first version of HTML created by Tim Berners-Lee had only 18 tags.
tec.illustrator2: Fun Fact: Illustrator started in 1987, being one of Adobe's first software programs.
tec.java1: Class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
tec.java2: Fun Fact: It was originally called 'Oak' after a tree that stood outside creator James Gosling's window.
tec.javascript1: Programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.
tec.javascript2: Fun Fact: JavaScript was created by Brendan Eich in just 10 days in 1995.
tec.jest1: Delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity.
tec.jest2: Fun Fact: Developed by Facebook, Jest is massively used for testing React, although it works with any JS project.
tec.jira1: Project management tool for agile teams.
tec.jira2: Fun Fact: The name JIRA comes from 'Gojira', the Japanese word for Godzilla.
tec.jquery1: Fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library.
tec.jquery2: Fun Fact: At its peak, jQuery was used on over 70% of the top 10 million websites.
tec.kanban1: Method for managing knowledge work with an emphasis on just-in-time delivery.
tec.kanban2: Fun Fact: Kanban originated on Toyota's production lines in the 1940s to improve efficiency.
tec.laravel1: PHP web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax.
tec.laravel2: Fun Fact: Laravel was created as a more advanced alternative to CodeIgniter.
tec.lit-html1: Efficient, expressive, extensible HTML templating library for JavaScript.
tec.lit-html2: Fun Fact: It uses native browser features (Template Literals) to be extremely lightweight and fast.
tec.mockito1: Open source testing framework for Java released under the MIT License.
tec.mockito2: Fun Fact: Its name is a play on the drink 'Mojito' and the action of making a 'mock'.
tec.mysql2: Fun Fact: The dolphin in the MySQL logo has a name: it's called 'Sakila'.
tec.nestjs1: Framework for building efficient, scalable Node.js server-side applications.
tec.nestjs2: Fun Fact: NestJS is heavily inspired by Angular, using modules, controllers, and dependency injection.
tec.node1: JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
tec.node2: Fun Fact: Ryan Dahl created Node.js because he wanted a way to know file upload progress in real-time.
tec.photoshop1: Raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc.
tec.photoshop2: Fun Fact: Photoshop 1.0 was released exclusively for Macintosh in 1990 and came on a floppy disk.
tec.php1: General-purpose scripting language especially suited to web development.
tec.php2: Fun Fact: PHP originally stood for 'Personal Home Page'.
tec.postman1: API platform for building and using APIs.
tec.postman2: Fun Fact: It started as a simple Chrome extension made by a developer to make his own work easier.
tec.react1: JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
tec.react2: Fun Fact: Initially created for Facebook's News Feed and then released as Open Source in 2013.
tec.rest1: Software architectural style that defines a set of constraints to be used for creating web services.
tec.rest2: Fun Fact: REST was defined by Roy Fielding in his doctoral dissertation in 2000.
tec.sass1: CSS extension language that adds power and elegance to the basic language.
tec.sass2: Fun Fact: SASS stands for 'Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets'.
tec.scrum1: Agile framework for managing complex knowledge work.
tec.scrum2: Fun Fact: The term 'Scrum' comes from Rugby, referring to a formation where the team works together to advance.
tec.soap1: Protocol specification for exchanging structured information in the implementation of web services.
tec.soap2: Fun Fact: SOAP was the dominant standard before REST, known for being very strict and verbose.
tec.spring-boot1: Makes it easy to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring based Applications.
tec.spring-boot2: Fun Fact: Spring Boot revolutionized the Java ecosystem by eliminating the infamous massive XML configuration.
tec.spring1: Application framework and inversion of control container for the Java platform.
tec.spring2: Fun Fact: Its first version was released in 2003 as a lightweight alternative to the complex J2EE standard.
tec.sql-server1: Relational database management system developed by Microsoft.
tec.sql-server2: Fun Fact: It was originally developed to run on OS/2, not Windows.
tec.sql1: Domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system.
tec.sql2: Fun Fact: Originally called SEQUEL (Structured English Query Language), but renamed due to a trademark.
tec.trello2: Fun Fact: The name 'Trello' comes from the word 'Trellis', symbolizing structure.
tec.typescript1: Typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.
tec.typescript2: Fun Fact: It was created by Anders Hejlsberg, the same lead architect behind C# and Turbo Pascal.
tec.vbscript1: Active Scripting language modeled on Visual Basic.
tec.vbscript2: Fun Fact: It was very popular for computer viruses in the 2000s, such as the famous 'ILOVEYOU' virus.
tec.visual-studio-code1: Lightweight but powerful source code editor.
tec.visual-studio-code2: Fun Fact: Despite being from Microsoft, it's built using web technologies (Electron) and is Open Source.
tec.visual-studio2: Fun Fact: The first version, Visual Studio 97, first consolidated tools like Visual Basic and Visual C++ into a single environment.
tec.wordpress1: Content management system (CMS) written in PHP.
tec.wordpress2: Fun Fact: It powers over 40% of all websites on the internet.

nttdata.desc1: NTT DATA, part of the NTT Group, is one of the top 10 IT service providers globally.
nttdata.desc2: They offer consulting services, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization, and managed services.
nttdata.task2: Creation, maintenance and improvement of various components for the front-end using Angular11+
nttdata.task3: Development of microservices using Java Spring Boot
nttdata.task5: Creation and maintenance of various components for the front-end using Angular11+
nttdata.task6: Building microservices using node js with lambda functions - AWS
nttdata.task7: MySQL Database Management with RDS Service - AWS
nttdata.task8: Adding modules for the front-end using Lit-Html (JS)
nttdata.task9: Front-end recreation of the silverlight system using Angular11+

renfe.desc1: Administration platform for railways and trains in Spain, including routes, loads, stations, etc.
renfe.task2: Creation, maintenance and improvement of various components for the front-end using Angular14

datadis.desc1: It is an electricity consumption data platform that allows the administrator to view, add, edit and delete various companies and their electricity consumption to a database through an API and users in general to verify electricity consumption in various periods of time..
datadis.desc2: Technologies used: Java Spring Boot - Docker - Angular13.
datadis.task1: Development of microservices using Java Spring Boot
datadis.task3: Creation and maintenance of various components for the front-end using Angular13

ree.desc1: Administrative system and dashboard for the electrical network of Spain.
ree.desc2: The system allows the general population to verify their electricity consumption through various graphs.
ree.desc3: Technologies used: Node js - lambda(AWS) -  RDS(AWS) - MySQL - LitHtml(JS).
ree.task1: Building microservices using node js with lambda functions - AWS
ree.task2: MySQL Database Management with RDS Service - AWS
ree.task3: Adding modules for the front-end using Lit-Html (JS)

ibost.desc1: The project consisted of migrating a Silverlight-based system to a new project using Angular11 technology.
ibost.desc2: iBost is a company that is dedicated to the distribution of various electrical resistances and its system required an administration of orders and customers.
ibost.desc3: Technologies used: jest.js - API REST - Angular11.
ibost.task1: Front-end recreation of the silverlight system using Angular11

adiasoft.desc1: It is an ERP environment sales software, for automated and administrative management for small and medium-sized companies.
adiasoft.desc2: The project consisted of creating a platform oriented towards electronic invoicing that can be integrated into both old and current systems.
adiasoft.desc3: Technologies used: Java Spring Boot - React - SQL server.
adiasoft.task1: Adaptation of an electronic billing system using React
adiasoft.task2: REST API development with Java Spring Boot
adiasoft.task3: Creation of tables, triggers and indexes SQL server

webControl.desc1: WebControl System is a company in the area of information technology, mainly oriented to mining companies.
webControl.desc2: The system is oriented towards business management, providing tools such as reports, shipment control, Kardex, CRUDs, etc.
webControl.desc3: Technologies used: Visual Basic Script - ASP.NET - SQL server - .NET CORE.
webControl.task3: Back-End REST API development with .NET CORE

orooplex.desc1: Orooplex is a web service oriented to business announcements, publicity and digital marketing.
orooplex.desc2: Technologies used: React - Angular - Node.Js - Express - MySQL.
orooplex.task1: Creation of web pages focused on advertising and marketing
orooplex.task3: Back-End REST API development with  MySQL / Express / Node.Js

frs.desc1: Francisco Rojas School is a private educational institution.
frs.desc2: The support specialist is in charge of advertising, maintenance and development of the institution's website and maintenance of digital equipment in the facility.
frs.desc3: Technologies used: wordpress - Adobe Illustrator - Adobe Photoshop
frs.task1: Creation of advertisements and announcements of the institution using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
frs.task2: Administration and creation of components of the web page using Wordpress
frs.task3: Maintenance of digital devices of the facilities

andromeda.desc1: Andromeda.Pe is a company whose business is the development of web applications mainly oriented to electronic billing.
andromeda.task1: Connection with SUNAT API to CRUD of tickets and billings in the system
andromeda.task3: Creation and maintenance of business logic using Laravel - php

auditel.desc1: Auditel is a wholesaler in telecommunications and security.
auditel.desc2: Implement security hardware and software to various institutions.
auditel.desc3: Technologies used: React - Express - Node.Js - MongoDB
auditel.task1: Creation of a web page in which students can perform various actions such as view notes, register entries, view messages, etc
auditel.task3: Creation of business logic using Express

profile.name: Renzo Davila
profile.summary: Systems Engineer and Senior Developer with over 8 years of experience in banking and corporate consulting. Specialist in modernizing legacy architectures and implementing Artificial Intelligence ecosystems.

tasks: Implement and evolve Cells components using Lit v3 (web components, reactive properties, efficient templates).
Maintain and patch existing components in Polymer 2, ensuring compatibility and stability.
Integration of AI agents
Optimize the development cycle through the use of GitHub Copilot and AI assistants
Create wrappers/adapters to interoperate Lit v3 with Polymer 2 while migrating the catalog.
Plan and execute migration from Polymer 2 to Lit v3 (refactoring templates, styles, lifecycles, events).
Identify legacy dependencies, risks, and technical debt; propose deprecation and replacement plans.
Ensure compatibility with ShadyDOM/Shadow DOM and ES Modules in target browsers.
Consume and apply design tokens, typography, palette, and theming from the BBVA design system.
Align behavior and look & feel with UX/UI, prototypes, and accessibility guidelines.
AI Agent Ecosystem Development: Creating autonomous assistants using LangChain and Python, integrating conversational memory and logical reasoning for business decision making.
Process Orchestration (BPA): Implementation of complex workflows in n8n (Self-hosted on Docker), automating lead capture, customer service, and document management.
Infrastructure & Data: Deployment of vector databases with Supabase and PostgreSQL for RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems. VPS (Hostinger/AWS) and Docker container administration.
Advanced Omnichannel: Integration of mass messaging APIs (Evolution API, WAHA) and sales flows in ManyChat.
Voice AI: Implementation of telephone agents with ultra-realistic voice synthesis (ElevenLabs) for call automation.
Development of dashboard with Next.js powered by AI tools for business administration
Business analysis and AI implementation to optimize processes and guarantee results
Operations Automation: Development of Python scripts and n8n flows to reduce manual load in report generation and system monitoring.
LLM Integration: Prototyping internal assistants using LangChain for corporate knowledge base queries.
Migration of applications from Angular.js to modern versions of Angular.
Creation and maintenance of user interfaces using Angular (version 2+) and React.js.
Code version management using Bitbucket and Git.
Mobile application development with Ionic.
Implementation of accessibility attributes in HTML tags following WAI-ARIA specification.
Meetings and projects following the SCRUM framework
Participation in software architecture definition for web projects, ensuring code scalability and maintainability.
Design and development of cross-platform mobile applications using technologies like Ionic or React Native.
Maintenance and creation of functionalities with Java
Creation and maintenance of Serverless microservices with Node.js and AWS Lambda.
Creation and maintenance of User Interfaces using Angular 2+
Version management with Bitbucket/Git
Maintenance and creation of microservices with NodeJS and AWS Lambda functions
DB and file management with RDS-AWS/S3-AWS
Testing with Karma (unit) and Cypress (end-to-end)
Web application performance optimization, analyzing and adjusting code and database.
Maintenance and creation of microservices using Spring Framework and Node.js.
Database administration using SQL Server.
Creation and maintenance of user interfaces using VBScript and ASP.NET.
Development and maintenance of REST API with .NET Core.
Collaboration with design and product teams to implement user-centered solutions and improve customer experience.
Creation of technical documentation and user guides to facilitate integration and use of new features by the team and clients.
Adaptation of an electronic invoicing system using React.
REST API development with Java Spring Framework.
Creation of microservices with SpringBoot
Creation of tables, triggers, and indexes in SQL Server.
Use of git for version management
Implementation of software development methodologies, such as DevOps, to improve efficiency in the development lifecycle.
Creation of web pages focused on advertising and marketing.
Development and maintenance of user interfaces using React and Angular.
Creation and maintenance of REST API with Express.js and Node.js.
Database management using MySQL.
Advertising management and creation of ads for the institution using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop.
Development and maintenance of user interfaces with WordPress.
Maintenance of digital devices.
Connection with SUNAT API for CRUD handling of tickets and invoices in the system.
Database administration using MySQL.
Creation and maintenance of business logic using Laravel and PHP.

cv.technologies:
Artificial Intelligence & Automation: LangChain | n8n (Workflow Automation) | Python | OpenAI API | Claude API | ElevenLabs | Supabase (Vector DB) | PostgreSQL | WAHA / Evolution API (WhatsApp) | ManyChat | GitHub Copilot.
Fullstack & Mobile Development: Angular (v2+) | React.js | Node.js | Express.js | Java Spring Boot | Ionic | React Native | Lit v3 (Web Components).
Cloud & DevOps: AWS (Lambda, S3, RDS, EC2) | Docker | Portainer | VPS Administration (Linux) | Git | Bitbucket | CI/CD Pipelines.
